    multiple-comparisons

    multiple-comparisons.Rmd

    Motivation

    This vignette covers how to apply the functions in dfdiffs to multiple datasets (separated by folder)

    Packages

    Our package

    library(dfdiffs)

    Similar packages

    library(janitor) # compare_df_cols
library(arsenal) # comparedf
library(diffdf)  # diffdf
library(testthat) # expect_equal
library(vetr) # alike

    Folder structure

    Below is a folder structure of datasets separated by year.

    fs::dir_tree("../inst/extdata/csv/by-year")
#> ../inst/extdata/csv/by-year
#> ├── 20
#> │   ├── PlayerBirth.csv
#> │   ├── PlayerDeath.csv
#> │   └── PlayerName.csv
#> └── 21
#>     ├── PlayerBirth.csv
#>     ├── PlayerDeath.csv
#>     └── PlayerName.csv

    We start by storing these files in a vector with list.files(), then we clean up the names a bit, and pass the list of paths to readr::read_csv with purrr::map():

    base_files <- list.files(path = "../inst/extdata/csv/by-year/20", 
  pattern = ".csv", recursive = TRUE, full.names = TRUE)
base_files_nms <- map_chr(base_files, base::basename)
#> Error in map_chr(base_files, base::basename): could not find function "map_chr"
base_dfs <- base_files |> 
  purrr::set_names(base_files_nms) |> 
  purrr::map(readr::read_csv)
#> Error in purrr::set_names(base_files, base_files_nms): object 'base_files_nms' not found
    compare_files <- list.files(path = "../inst/extdata/csv/by-year/21", 
  pattern = ".csv", recursive = TRUE, full.names = TRUE)
compare_files_nms <- map_chr(compare_files, base::basename)
#> Error in map_chr(compare_files, base::basename): could not find function "map_chr"
compare_dfs <- compare_files |> 
  purrr::set_names(compare_files_nms) |> 
  purrr::map(readr::read_csv)
#> Error in purrr::set_names(compare_files, compare_files_nms): object 'compare_files_nms' not found

    Iteration

    We’re going to follow the iteration steps from Charlotte Wickham’s Happy R Users Purrr Tutorial

    1. DO IT FOR ONE
    2. TURN IT INTO A RECIPE
    3. DO IT FOR ALL!

    Do it for one (or two)

    We’re going to use the arsenal::comparedf() function first. Remember that this function requires an additional summary() call!

    arsenal::comparedf 

    by_var <- "playerID"
cdf_people <- arsenal::comparedf(
  x = base_dfs$PlayerName.csv, 
  y = compare_dfs$PlayerName.csv, 
  by = by_var)
#> Error in is.data.frame(x): object 'base_dfs' not found
sumcdf_people <- summary(cdf_people)
#> Error in summary(cdf_people): object 'cdf_people' not found
names(sumcdf_people)
#> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'sumcdf_people' not found

    diffdf::diffdf

    Next we’ll use the diffdf::diffdf() function.

    diffdf_people <- diffdf::diffdf(
  compare = compare_dfs$PlayerName.csv, 
  base = base_dfs$PlayerName.csv, 
  keys = "playerID")
#> Error in diffdf::diffdf(compare = compare_dfs$PlayerName.csv, base = base_dfs$PlayerName.csv, : object 'base_dfs' not found
diffdf_people |> names()
#> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'diffdf_people' not found

    Just to ensure we’re getting the same display in the output from both functions, we’re going to use the diffs.byvar.table/NumDiff tables, and the diffs.table/ VarDiff_ tables.

    diffs.byvar.table 

    sumcdf_people[["diffs.byvar.table"]] |> 
  select(Variable = var.x, 
         `No of Differences` = n) |> 
  knitr::kable(caption = "diffs.byvar.table") |> 
  kableExtra::kable_paper()
#> Error in select(sumcdf_people[["diffs.byvar.table"]], Variable = var.x, : object 'sumcdf_people' not found

    NumDiff 

    diffdf_people[["NumDiff"]] |> 
  knitr::kable(caption = "NumDiff") |> 
  kableExtra::kable_paper()
#> Error in knitr::kable(diffdf_people[["NumDiff"]], caption = "NumDiff"): object 'diffdf_people' not found

    diffs.table 

    sumcdf_people[["diffs.table"]] |> 
  unnest(values.x) |> 
  unnest(values.y) |> 
  select(
    VARIABLE = var.x,
    all_of(by_var),
    BASE = values.x,
    COMPARE = values.y
  ) |> 
  knitr::kable(caption = "diffs.table") |> 
  kableExtra::kable_paper()
#> Error in unnest(unnest(sumcdf_people[["diffs.table"]], values.x), values.y): could not find function "unnest"

    VarDiff_ tables 

    tbl_names <- names(diffdf_people)
#> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'diffdf_people' not found
vardiff_tbls <- tbl_names[stringr::str_detect(tbl_names, "VarDiff_")]
#> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'tbl_names' not found
bind_rows(diffdf_people[vardiff_tbls]) |> 
  knitr::kable(caption = "'VarDiff_' tables") |> 
  kableExtra::kable_paper()
#> Error in bind_rows(diffdf_people[vardiff_tbls]): could not find function "bind_rows"

    Turn it into a recipe

    We have two vectors with file paths (.x and .y)

    map2(.x = base_dfs, .y = compare_files, )

    And the .f is our arsenal::comparedf or diffdf::diffdf functions.

    map2(.x = base_dfs, .y = compare_files, .f = arsenal::comparedf)
map2(.x = compare_files, .y = base_dfs, .f = diffdf::diffdf)

    We can pass the by and keys arguments to ....

    purrr::map2(.x =  base_dfs, .y = compare_dfs, 
            .f = arsenal::comparedf, by = "playerID")
    purrr::map2(.x =  compare_dfs,  .y = base_dfs, 
            .f = diffdf::diffdf, keys = "playerID")

    Do it for all

    map2() + arsenal::comparedf

    Now we use the purrr::map2() function to compare all of the items in base_dfs to compare_dfs.

    all_cdfs <- purrr::map2(
  .x =  base_dfs, 
  .y = compare_dfs, 
  .f = arsenal::comparedf, 
  by = "playerID")
#> Error in purrr::map2(.x = base_dfs, .y = compare_dfs, .f = arsenal::comparedf, : object 'base_dfs' not found
all_scdfs <- purrr::map(all_cdfs, .f = summary)
#> Error in purrr::map(all_cdfs, .f = summary): object 'all_cdfs' not found
all_scdfs[["PlayerName.csv"]] |> names()
#> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'all_scdfs' not found

    map2() + diffdf::diffdf 

    all_diffdfs <- purrr::map2(
  .x =  base_dfs, 
  .y = compare_dfs, 
  .f = diffdf::diffdf, 
  keys = "playerID")
#> Error in purrr::map2(.x = base_dfs, .y = compare_dfs, .f = diffdf::diffdf, : object 'base_dfs' not found
all_diffdfs[["PlayerName.csv"]] |> names()
#> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'all_diffdfs' not found

    Extracting tables

    Now that we have two lists with multiple comparisons, we need to be able to extract the two table
